page.title: 05FARMING
page.content: CHIVERS FARM. Mr. Bascham has worked as area farm manage at Chivers for 10 years .The farms grow barley , cereal fruit plums apples pears peas and beans. They harvest their fruit by hand because apples bruise easily.They plant their crops in September. He sprays the field every seven days to keep theinsects from eating the fruit. The area of farms has a turnover of Â£1000000 per year.13 men work fulltime on the farm.The soil is clay it is the heaviest in the country.He never waters the crops because the ground retains water easily.Chivers own 3000 acres . They can store 3000 tons of fruit. Chivers are helping conservation in the Hardwick area by replanting woodland, and laying new hedges.
